chunk_00001.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Central Perk coffee shop — daytime, warm interior lighting with natural light from windows

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: light blue sweater - dark pants - long, brown hair in a half-up style - animated, expressive
Unidentified person (barista): beige jacket - dark shirt - gray hair - glasses - serious, focused
Unidentified person (customer): dark-colored top - light-colored pants - blonde hair - seated, reading
Unidentified person (customer): dark-colored top - dark pants - dark hair - seated, reading
Unidentified person (customer): dark-colored top - dark pants - dark hair - seated, reading

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel Green sits at the bar counter, gesturing with her hands as she speaks to the barista. The barista listens, then responds while holding a blue cloth and a coffee mug. Rachel leans forward, holding the barista's hand briefly, then continues talking. The barista gestures back while speaking. In the background, other patrons are seated at tables, reading or conversing. The scene shifts to show the entire group of friends seated in the living room area, with Rachel standing and gesturing animatedly.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee mugs: various colors (on counter and tables)
- Bar counter: marble top (with coffee machine and supplies)
- Wooden tables: with magazines and coffee mugs
- Orange couch: in the center of the living room area
- Brick wall decor: with framed pictures and shelves
- Red curtains: behind the bar area
- Flower arrangement: on a table near the window

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel Green discusses requesting a $100 advance on her salary to spend Thanksgiving with her family, mentioning her father's usual payment for her ski trip. The barista responds with a mix of concern and support, acknowledging her efforts and offering encouragement. The conversation has a casual, supportive tone, with Rachel appearing earnest and the barista appearing understanding and empathetic. Other patrons in the background are engaged in their own conversations, adding to the lively atmosphere of the coffee shop.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel Green stands up and gestures animatedly to the group in the living room area. The barista places a coffee mug on the counter. The scene shifts from the bar area to the living room area, showing the group of friends seated and interacting.
chunk_00001.subtitles: Terry, I know I haven't worked here very long... ...but I was wondering, do you think it would be possible... ...if I got a $100 advance on my salary? An advance? It's so that I can spend Thanksgiving with my family. See, every year, we go skiing in Vail, and normally my father pays for my ticket... ...but I've sort of started this whole independent thing, you know... ...which is actually why I took this "job." Rachel, Rachel, sweetheart. You're a terrible, terrible waitress. Really, really awful. Okay, I hear what you're saying. I'm with you. Um... But I'm trying really hard, and I think I'm doing better. I really do. Does anybody need coffee? MAN: Yeah, over here. WOMAN: Yeah, I do.
chunk_00001.episode: 1x09 - The One Where Underdog Gets Away

chunk_00002.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Central Perk coffee shop — daytime, natural window light and interior lighting. The setting features the iconic orange couch, wooden tables, and brick wall decor.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: light-colored blouse - patterned skirt - long, wavy brown hair - smiling and animated
Monica Geller: dark-colored sweater - jeans - dark, shoulder-length hair - serious expression
Phoebe Buffay: striped top - dark pants - long, curly blonde hair - laughing and lying on floor
Chandler Bing: light-colored shirt - dark pants - short, brown hair - smirking
Joey Tribbiani: dark jacket - light shirt - dark, medium-length hair - smiling
Ross Geller: dark suit - white shirt - short, dark hair - serious expression
Unidentified person: dark jacket - dark pants - dark hair - standing near bar

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel stands and gestures excitedly while speaking to the group. Monica sits on the couch, looking concerned. Phoebe lies on the floor laughing, holding a string. Chandler leans back in his chair, smirking. Joey stands near the couch, smiling. Ross sits in a chair, looking serious. An unidentified person stands near the bar.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee mugs: various colors (on tables)
- Orange couch (center of frame)
- Wooden tables (with items on them)
- Brick wall decor (background)
- Menu board (behind counter)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
The conversation involves a discussion about a man who comes in frequently. The tone is casual and slightly humorous, with Rachel appearing animated and Monica looking concerned. The group reacts with varying expressions, including laughter and seriousness.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Scene begins with all characters seated or standing in the coffee shop. Rachel stands up and gestures. Phoebe lies on the floor. Chandler leans back in his chair. Joey stands near the couch. Ross sits in a chair. An unidentified person stands near the bar.
chunk_00002.subtitles: MAN: Yeah, over here. WOMAN: Yeah, I do. Heh. Look at that. Excuse me, sir? Hi. You come in here all the time. MAN: Uh-huh. - I was just wondering...

chunk_00003.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Central Perk coffee shop — daytime, warm interior lighting with natural light from windows

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: light-colored cardigan - dark pants - long, wavy brown hair - smiling and animated
Monica Geller: dark-colored sweater - dark pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - serious expression
Ross Geller: light-colored shirt - dark vest and tie - dark pants - short brown hair - surprised expression
Chandler Bing: dark-colored jacket - dark pants - short brown hair - relaxed, smiling
Phoebe Buffay: striped shirt - dark pants - long blonde hair - looking down, expression neutral
Joey Tribbiani: blue sweater - dark pants - short brown hair - smiling, relaxed

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel enters the coffee shop, holding a tray, and walks toward the counter. Monica enters from the back, carrying a red bag, and sits on the couch. Ross sits in a chair, reading a magazine, and looks up as Monica approaches. Chandler stands up from the couch, walks toward the counter, and begins talking to Rachel. Joey sits at a table, holding a coffee mug, and smiles as he listens to the conversation. Phoebe sits on the couch, looking down at her lap, and occasionally glances up at the others.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee mugs: various colors (on tables)
- Orange couch (center of frame)
- Wooden tables and chairs
- Menu board (behind counter)
- Red bag (held by Monica)
- Magazine (held by Ross)
- Coffee mug (held by Joey)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel discusses a financial matter with a customer, mentioning an advance on tips. Ross and Chandler react with surprise to news about Ross's parents going to Puerto Rico for Thanksgiving. Monica and Chandler greet each other casually. Joey jokes about looking like Joey Tribbiani, and the group laughs. The conversation has a casual, humorous tone, with Rachel appearing animated and the others reacting with amusement or surprise.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel enters from the left side of the frame and walks toward the counter.
Monica enters from the back and sits on the couch.
Ross looks up from his magazine as Monica approaches.
Chandler stands up and walks toward the counter.
Joey remains seated at the table, holding his mug.
chunk_00003.subtitles: ...you think there's a possibility you could give me an advance on my tips? Huh? No. RACHEL: Okay, okay. That's fine, fine. Sorry about that spill before. [SIGHS] Only 98.50 to go. - Hey. Hey. ROSS & CHANDLER: Hey. Ross, did you know that Mom and Dad are going to Puerto Rico for Thanksgiving? What? No, they're not. - Yes, they are. The Blymans invited them. - You're wrong. - I am not wrong. - You're wrong. No, I just talked to them. I'm calling Mom. - Hey, hey. MONICA & CHANDLER: Hey. - Hey. - Coffee. And this from the Cry for Help Department: Are you wearing makeup? Yes, I am. As of today, I am officially Joey Tribbiani, actor/model. Thank you. That's funny, I was thinking you look more like Joey Tribbiani, man/woman.
chunk_00003.episode: 1x09 - The One Where Underdog Gets Away

chunk_00004.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Central Perk coffee shop — daytime, warm interior lighting with natural light from windows

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Joey Tribbiani: blue sweatshirt - dark pants - dark, medium-length hair - smiling and animated
Chandler Bing: plaid blazer over dark shirt - dark pants - short, dark hair - relaxed, smirking
Rachel Green: light blue dress - patterned skirt - shoulder-length blonde hair - serious, listening
Monica Geller: dark sweater with gray pattern - dark pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - expressive, gesturing
Phoebe Buffay: striped shirt - green pants - long, blonde hair - concerned, seated
Ross Geller: light blue shirt with dark vest and tie - dark pants - short, dark hair - serious, gesturing

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Joey sits at a table holding a mug, talking animatedly while gesturing. Chandler sits on the couch, leaning back with arms crossed, listening and smiling. Rachel sits beside Chandler, looking concerned and occasionally speaking. Monica stands behind the couch, gesturing expressively while talking to Phoebe, who sits on the couch looking downcast. Ross enters from the doorway, walks to a chair, and sits down, looking around the room. The group appears to be engaged in a conversation about Thanksgiving plans and health-related topics.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee mugs: various colors (on tables)
- Orange couch (center of frame)
- Wooden table (with mugs and papers)
- Brick wall decor (background)
- Menu board (behind counter)
- Flower arrangement (on table)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses health-related topics with the group, mentioning the City Free Clinic and Lyme disease. The conversation has a casual, slightly humorous tone, with Joey appearing amused and Chandler smirking. Monica gestures expressively while speaking, and Rachel listens with a serious expression. Phoebe appears concerned, and Ross looks around the room as he speaks.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Ross enters the frame from the doorway and sits down in a chair.
Monica moves from standing behind the couch to sitting on the couch next to Phoebe.
Joey sets down his mug and picks it up again while talking.
chunk_00004.subtitles: That's funny, I was thinking you look more like Joey Tribbiani, man/woman. What were you modeling for? You know those posters for the City Free Clinic? Oh, wow. You're gonna be one of those healthy, healthy, healthy guys? - Ah? - The asthma guy's really cute. - Oh, he is. RACHEL: Isn't he? - You know which one you're gonna be? - No, no. But I hear Lyme disease is open, so, you know... Good luck, man. I hope you get it. Thanks. Well, you were right. How can they do this to us, huh? It's Thanksgiving. Aw. Tell you what. How about if I cook dinner at my place? I'll make it just like Mom's. Will you make the mashed potatoes with the lumps? You know they're not actually supposed to...? I'll work on the lumps. - Joey, you're going home, right? - Yeah. And I assume, Chandler, you're still boycotting all the Pilgrim holidays? Yes, every single one of them. Phoebe, you're gonna be with your grandma? Yeah, and her boyfriend. But we're celebrating Thanksgiving in December because he's lunar.
chunk_00004.episode: 1x09 - The One Where Underdog Gets Away

chunk_00005.subtitles: But we're celebrating Thanksgiving in December because he's lunar. So you're free Thursday, then? - Yeah. Oh, can I come? - Yeah. Rach, you still thinking you're gonna make it to Vail? Absolutely. Shoop, shoop, shoop. - Only $102 to go. - I thought it was 98.50. Yeah, well, it was, but I broke a cup. Well, I'm off to Carol's. Ooh, ooh, why don't we invite her? Ooh, ooh, because she's my ex-wife... ...and will probably wanna bring her, ooh, ooh, lesbian life partner. [SUSAN CHUCKLES] Hi. Is Carol here? - No, she's at a faculty meeting. - Oh. Well, I just came by to pick up my skull. Well, not mine, but...
chunk_00005.episode: 1x09 - The One Where Underdog Gets Away

chunk_00006.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — daytime, warm ambient lighting with decorative lamps and natural light filtering through curtains.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: dark-colored coat - light-colored shirt and tie - dark, short hair - expression shifts from serious to amused
Unidentified person: red shirt - blue jeans - long, curly brown hair - expression animated and smiling

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross Geller enters the apartment and stands near the doorway, gesturing as he speaks to the woman in the red shirt. She responds with animated expressions, crossing her arms and then crouching to look under a TV stand. Ross walks further into the room, examining a bookshelf and then a counter, appearing to search for something. The woman stands up and moves toward the counter, smiling as she interacts with Ross.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Bookshelf: wooden, filled with books and decorative items (including a golden statue and framed photos)
- TV: black, placed under a cabinet
- Lamp: white lampshade, on a side table
- Flowers: colorful bouquet in a green vase
- Counter: wooden, with papers, a microwave, and various kitchen items
- Decorative items: angel figurine on the door, framed artwork on the wall

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross Geller discusses a book with the woman, mentioning a class and a baby, while she reacts with amusement and curiosity. The conversation has a casual and slightly humorous tone, with Ross appearing amused and the woman responding with animated expressions and gestures.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
- Ross Geller moves from the doorway to the bookshelf and then to the counter
- The woman crouches under the TV stand and then stands up
- Ross picks up a book from the bookshelf and examines it
- The woman moves toward the counter and interacts with Ross
chunk_00006.subtitles: Well, not mine, but... - Come in. - Thanks. Yeah, Carol borrowed it for a class, and I have to get it back to the museum. What's it look like? Kind of like a big face without skin. Yes, heh, I'm familiar with the concept. - We can just look for it. - Okay. Wow, you guys, heh, sure have a lot of books about being a lesbian. Well, you know, you have to take a course. Otherwise they don't let you do it. Hey, hey, Yertle the Turtle. A classic. Actually, I'm reading it to the baby. [CHUCKLES] The baby that hasn't been born yet?
chunk_00006.episode: 1x09 - The One Where Underdog Gets Away

chunk_00007.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — evening, warm artificial lighting with visible lamps and indoor decor.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: dark-colored cardigan over light shirt, dark tie, dark pants — Hair: dark, short — Expression: animated, gesturing while speaking
Unidentified person: red shirt, blue jeans — Hair: curly, light brown — Expression: smiling, engaged in conversation
Phoebe Buffay: multicolored cardigan over dark top, light-colored pants — Hair: blonde, long, wavy — Expression: smiling, interacting with others
Unidentified person: light-colored sweater — Hair: dark, short — Expression: surprised, looking at turkey
Joey Tribbiani: plaid shirt — Hair: dark, medium length — Expression: relaxed, seated

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross Geller stands and gestures while talking to an unidentified woman in a red shirt. The woman walks toward him, smiling, and they engage in conversation near a table with flowers. Later, the scene shifts to a kitchen area where Phoebe Buffay and another unidentified person are preparing a turkey while Joey Tribbiani sits nearby. Ross Geller is not visible in this later segment.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Table: wooden, with open magazine and vase of yellow and white flowers
- Turkey: raw, in aluminum pan on table
- Vase: clear glass, holding yellow and white flowers
- Lamp: white lampshade, on side table
- Refrigerator: white, with magnets and notes
- Kitchen counter: blue cabinets, with various items including pumpkins and a red mixer
- Bag: black, with "DAG D'AG" logo, held by unidentified person

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross Geller discusses a baby and the idea of talking to it with the unidentified woman. The conversation turns to the baby hearing sounds, with the woman expressing belief in this concept. The tone is casual and slightly humorous, with Ross appearing animated and the woman smiling and engaged. The dialogue shifts to a turkey preparation scene where Phoebe Buffay and another person discuss the turkey, with Joey Tribbiani listening.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Unidentified woman enters frame from right side
Ross Geller moves from standing to sitting position
Phoebe Buffay moves from standing to leaning over turkey
Joey Tribbiani remains seated throughout the scene
chunk_00007.subtitles: The baby that hasn't been born yet? Uh, wouldn't that mean you're... ...crazy? What, you don't think they can hear sounds in there? You're not serious. I mean, you really talk to it? Yeah, all the time. I want the baby to know my voice. Do you, uh...? Do you talk about me? - Yeah, yeah. All the time. - Really? But, um, we just refer to you as "Bobo the sperm guy." Look, if she's talking to it, I just think I should get some belly time too. I mean, not that I believe any of this. Oh, I believe it. I think the baby can totally hear everything. - Really? - I can show you. This will seem a little weird. But you put your head inside this turkey... ...and then we'll all talk, and you'll hear everything we say.
chunk_00007.episode: 1x09 - The One Where Underdog Gets Away

chunk_00008.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — evening, warm lamp lighting with visible kitchen area in background.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Phoebe Buffay: dark-colored patterned sweater - unclear lower clothing - long, blonde hair - smiling and animated
Ross Geller: grey cable-knit sweater - unclear lower clothing - short, dark hair - expression shifts from concerned to smiling
Rachel Green: black long-sleeved top - blue jeans - shoulder-length brown hair - initially serious, then surprised, then smiling
Monica Geller: red turtleneck sweater - light-colored pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - serious, then smiling
Chandler Bing: light-colored jacket over plaid shirt - dark pants - short, dark hair - serious, then smiling

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel sits on the couch, examining a piece of paper and money, then reacts with surprise and excitement. Monica and Phoebe stand nearby, smiling and gesturing as they discuss the situation. Ross sits at the table, looking up at the group with a smile. Chandler enters the room, standing near the couch, and joins the conversation. The group appears to be celebrating a shared financial success, with Rachel expressing gratitude and Monica and Phoebe offering support.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Turkey (wrapped in plastic) on table
- Coffee mugs (unclear color) on table
- Lamp (on side table)
- Blue kitchen cabinets (visible in background)
- Decorative items (on shelves and walls)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel discusses her financial situation with the group, expressing surprise and gratitude for their help. The conversation has a happy, supportive tone, with Rachel appearing surprised and Monica and Phoebe reacting with smiles and encouragement. Ross and Chandler join in, smiling and contributing to the positive atmosphere.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel sits down on the couch
Chandler enters the room from the left side
Ross remains seated at the table throughout
Monica and Phoebe stand near the couch, shifting positions slightly
Rachel picks up and examines the money and paper
Rachel stands up and interacts with Monica and Phoebe
chunk_00008.subtitles: ...and then we'll all talk, and you'll hear everything we say. I'd just like to say I'm totally behind this experiment. In fact, I'd very much like to butter your head. ROSS: Hey. MONICA: Hey, Rach. - Did you make your money? RACHEL: No, not even close. Forget Vail. Forget seeing my family. Forget shoop, shoop, shoop. Uh, Rach... ...here's your mail. Thanks. You can just put it on the table. Heh. No. Here's your mail. Thanks. You can just put it on the table. Would you just open it? Oh, my God. - Oh, you guys are great. - Aw. Ha, ha. RACHEL: Aw. - We all chipped in. - We did? - You owe me 20 bucks. Thank you. Thank you so much.
chunk_00008.episode: 1x09 - The One Where Underdog Gets Away

chunk_00009.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment kitchen and living room — evening, warm artificial lighting with decorative autumn elements visible.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Monica Geller: red turtleneck sweater - jeans - dark, shoulder-length hair - animated expression
Rachel Green: black long-sleeved top - dark pants - shoulder-length brown hair - concerned expression
Chandler Bing: plaid shirt under light-colored jacket - dark pants - short brown hair - serious expression
Phoebe Buffay: striped cardigan over dark top - dark pants - blonde, shoulder-length hair - neutral expression
Joey Tribbiani: grey sweater - dark pants - dark, medium-length hair - relaxed expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Monica stands near the table holding a grocery bag, talking to Chandler who is seated and gesturing with his hands. Rachel stands nearby, looking concerned. Phoebe stands beside Rachel, observing the interaction. Joey is seated at the table, looking up at the group. Chandler moves to stand and talks to Rachel, gesturing emphatically as he speaks. Monica walks away from the table, carrying the bag. The scene cuts to a subway station where Chandler and Rachel are seen walking and then stopping to talk near a bench.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Raw turkey: in aluminum pan (on table)
- Grocery bag: with visible text "D'AG" (on table)
- Refrigerator: white, with magnets and photos (left side)
- Blue shelves: with various kitchen items (background)
- Wooden table: with turkey and bag
- Autumn decorations: pumpkins and leaves (on shelves and table)
- Subway bench: wooden, with a map on the wall behind it
- Trash can: black metal, near bench

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Chandler discusses Thanksgiving dinner with Rachel, mentioning his traditional feast including tomato soup and Funyuns. The conversation has a casual tone, with Chandler appearing serious and Rachel reacting with concern. Monica is seen holding a grocery bag and talking to Chandler, while Joey sits at the table observing.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Monica walks away from the table carrying the grocery bag.
Chandler stands up and moves to talk to Rachel.
Scene cuts to subway station where Chandler and Rachel are walking.
Chandler stops to talk to Rachel near a bench.
chunk_00009.subtitles: Thank you. Thank you so much. Chandler, here you go. Got your traditional holiday feast. Got your tomato soup... ...your grilled-cheese fixings, and your family-size bag of Funyuns. Wait, this is what you're having for Thanksgiving dinner? What is it with you and this holiday? [SIGHS] All right, I'm 9 years old. - Aw. - Aw, I hate this story. We've just finished Thanksgiving dinner. I have... And I remember this part vividly. - A mouthful of pumpkin pie. And this is the moment my parents choose to tell me they're getting divorced. Oh, my God. It's very difficult to enjoy Thanksgiving dinner once you've seen it in reverse. Hi. - We used to work together. - We did? Yeah, at Macy's. You're the Obsession girl, right?
chunk_00009.episode: 1x09 - The One Where Underdog Gets Away

chunk_00010.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Subway station entrance — nighttime — artificial lighting

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Joey Tribbiani: dark-colored herringbone coat - dark turtleneck - dark, styled hair - animated, smiling
Unidentified person: black coat - black beret - short, light brown hair - smiling, engaged

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Joey Tribbiani stands and gestures animatedly while talking to an unidentified woman wearing a beret and scarf. The woman responds with smiles and gestures, appearing amused and engaged in the conversation. They remain in a fixed position near a bench and trash can, with background pedestrians passing by.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Trash can: black metal (near bench)
- Bench: wooden (against tiled wall)
- Map poster: on wall behind characters
- Scarf: red and black plaid (worn by unidentified woman)
- Beret: black (worn by unidentified woman)
- Coat: dark-colored herringbone (worn by Joey Tribbiani)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Joey Tribbiani discusses his admiration for the unidentified woman's skills, calling her "the best in the business" and complimenting her scent and style. The conversation has a joking, flirty tone, with Joey appearing enthusiastic and the woman reacting with amusement and laughter. The woman mentions she has to leave, prompting Joey to react with surprise.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Unidentified person turns and gestures toward the background as if indicating she must leave.
Joey Tribbiani reacts with surprise and gestures toward her as she turns away.
chunk_00010.subtitles: Yeah, at Macy's. You're the Obsession girl, right? - Yes. - I was the Aramis guy. - Aramis? Aramis? Aramis? - Oh. Yeah, right. I gotta tell you, you're the best in the business. - Get out. JOEY: I'm serious. You're amazing. You know when to spritz. You know when to lay back. Really? You don't know what that means to me. [CHUCKLES] Mm, mm. You smell great tonight. Uh, what are you wearing? Nothing. [BOTH CHUCKLE] Listen, do you wanna go get a drink or something? Yeah, that would be... - What's wrong? - I just remembered I have to do something. Oh. What? Um... Leave. JOEY: Whoa. Wait, wait, wait.
chunk_00010.episode: 1x09 - The One Where Underdog Gets Away

chunk_00013.subtitles: Okay, I'm gonna get my stuff. Chandler, will you just come in, already? No, thank you. I prefer to keep a safe distance from all this merriment. Look out. Incoming pumpkin pie. [MIMICS PLANE ZOOMING] Okay, we all laughed when you did it with the stuffing, but that's not funny anymore. Hey, Monica, I got a question. I don't see any Tater Tots. That's not a question. But my mom always makes them. It's like a tradition. You get a little piece of turkey on your fork, a little cranberry sauce, and a Tot. I mean, it's bad enough I can't be with my family... ...because of my disease. All right, fine. Tonight's potatoes will be both mashed with lumps... ...and in the form of Tots. Yes. All right, I'm off to talk to my unborn child. - Ah. - Okay, Mom never hit.

chunk_00017.subtitles: Hey, hey. That tone won't make me go any faster. - Joey. - That one will. ROSS: And everyone's telling me: "You gotta pick a major. You gotta pick a major." [SINGING] Here we come Walkin' down the street Get the funniest looks from Everyone we meet Hey, hey... - Hey, uh, did you just feel that? - I did. - Well, does it always, uh...? - No, no, that was the first. - Keep singing. No. I wouldn't say I had the keys unless I had the keys. And I obviously did not have the keys. Okay, all right, that's it. Enough with the keys. No one say "keys." Why would I have the keys?

chunk_00019.subtitles: Why would I have the keys? Aside from the fact that you said you did? - But I didn't. - Well, you should have. MONICA: Why? RACHEL: Because. Why? Because everything is my responsibility? Isn't it enough that I'm making Thanksgiving dinner? Everyone wants a different kind of potato, so I'm making different kinds of potatoes. You know, does anybody care what kind of potatoes I want? No, no, no! You know, just as long as Phoebe gets her peas and onions... ...and Mario gets his Tots. [SOBBING IN HIGH VOICE] It's my first Thanksgiving, and I... It's all burnt, and I can't... [SOBS] Okay, Monica, only dogs can hear you now, so... Look, the door's open. Here we go. Oh, God. - Ooh. - Oh. Well, the turkey's burnt. Potatoes are ruined. Potatoes are ruined. Potatoes are ruined. [SINGING] Here we come Walkin' down the... [ROSS HUMS]

This isn't exactly the kind of Thanksgiving you planned... ...but for me this has been really great, you know? I think because it didn't involve divorce... ...or projectile vomiting. I was just thinking, if you'd gone to Vail... ...or if you guys had been with your family, or if you didn't have... ...syphilis and stuff... ...we wouldn't be all together, you know? So I guess what I'm trying to say... ...is that I'm very thankful that all of your Thanksgivings sucked. RACHEL & JOEY: That's so sweet. RACHEL: Thank you. ROSS: Mm.
